meanings.definition: To pierce or impale on a stake or sharp object.
meanings.sent1: The hunter was empaling the fish he caught on a sharp stick.
meanings.sent2: She empaled the needle through the fabric to sew a button.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was empaling the vegetables to make a veggie kebab.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight empaled the clouds, creating a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The knight empaled the enemy with his sword, winning the battle.

meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with a fence or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was empaling the garden to keep out the rabbits.
meanings.sent2: They empaled the construction site with caution tape to keep people out.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were empaling their fort with invisible walls.
meanings.sent4: The fog empaled the town, making it feel isolated from the world.
meanings.sent5: The king empaled his castle with high walls to protect it from invaders.

meanings.sent1: She empaled the picture on the wall with a nail.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter empaled the shelf securely to the wall.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel empaled the acorn in the ground to save it for later.
meanings.sent4: The roots empaled the rock, holding it in place on the hill.
meanings.sent5: The glue empaled the pieces together, creating a strong bond.
